meanings.definition: The state or quality of not being capable of movement.
meanings.sent1: The nonmotility of the rock made it impossible to roll down the hill.
meanings.sent2: The nonmotility of the tree roots kept them firmly in place.
meanings.sent3: The nonmotility of the sloth was both impressive and amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her nonmotility in the face of danger was like a statue frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The nonmotility of the caterpillar on the leaf was a peaceful sight in the garden.

meanings.definition: The lack of ability to move spontaneously.
meanings.sent1: The patient's nonmotility was a concern for the doctors.
meanings.sent2: The nonmotility of the robot was intentional to maintain safety in the factory.
meanings.sent3: The nonmotility of the toy car was a source of amusement for the children.
meanings.sent4: Her nonmotility during the dance performance was like a frozen moment on stage.
meanings.sent5: The nonmotility of the snail made it easy to observe its slow movements.
